slides.script: I forgot my best friend's birthday...for the 3rd year in a row. I felt like the worst friend ever. My mind was so foggy, I could barely keep track of my own schedule, let alone remember important dates.

slides.script: Turns out, I wasn't alone. My mom, my sister, even my co-workers were all struggling with the same thing - constant stress and brain fog. We joked about having "mommy brain", but deep down, we were all frustrated.

slides.script: What doctors don't tell you is that chronic stress can literally shrink your brain. While I was struggling to remember basic things, my brain was slowly deteriorating. I felt like I was losing myself.

slides.script: That's when my sister told me about an ancient herb called Ashwagandha. She said it had been used for centuries in Ayurvedic medicine to calm the mind and protect the brain. I was skeptical, but I figured I had nothing to lose.

slides.script: Turns out, Ashwagandha is backed by some serious science. It's been clinically proven to reduce cortisol (the stress hormone) by up to 30%, improve memory and focus, and even regenerate brain cells. No wonder it's been a best-kept secret for centuries!
